author: potuz
content:
<@!488328812501663744> bringing this to off-topic:
> then thats fatal flaw with ethereum. what happens if everyone has to exit for some other reason? network outage, regulations, etc may force pool operators to exit

author: potuz
content: You may consider it a flaw, but the situation that is being analized is the following: 1) for some reasons a vast majority of validators cannot submit attestations nor propose blocks cause they will be subject to slashing. 2)  The network cannot finalize cause the vast majority of validators are inactive because of 1). 3) The vast majority of validators decide to exit because of 1,2. In this situation, the network will not finalize for a very long time, everyone will leak quadratically for a while until enough validators have exited. And even after all is done, you are left with a network with the minority of validators.

author: potuz
content: So in the scenario of 1) I think it's reasonable to expect that there's a manual intervention. The question I was raising is that a) this manual intervention is required just after 15 minutes, instead of possibly days today, and b) this manual intervention may involve coordination among all consensus clients, even though their users may not have been using the faulty execution client. This is a tough situation to be.
